lead_paragraph: After nearly three decades, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has effectively cut ties with Joseph Percoco, a former aide who is under federal investigation.

byline.contributor: William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting from New York, and Doris Burke contributed research.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and VIVIAN YEE

headline.print_headline: How Cuomo’s Loyal Problem-Solver Became a Problem for the Governor
headline.main: How Joseph Percoco, Cuomo’s Problem-Solver, Became a Problem

snippet: After nearly three decades, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has effectively cut ties with Joseph Percoco, a former aide who is under federal investigation.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo has increasingly distanced himself in comments from Joseph Percoco, former aid and close confidant who has come under federal investigation; Cuomo cut ties with Percoco just days after federal agents raided Percoco's home in April, looking for evidence that he and his wife had improperly received thousands of dollars from companies that had done business with New York State.
